Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <jintaa> Hey everyone; liking the community ethos thus far. I'm not a tech person, so indulging my ignorance: 1. what benefit I am receiving from staking VRSC on the agama wallet? And 2. On avg, how often can I expect to get a block reward from mining w the agama wallet (approx 83 mega hash/s)? And finally, 3. I'm mining/staking w agama, but also purchase from DP occasionally- do I have to update my staking each time I add more VRSC from DP, or is the TOTAL in my agama wallet automatically staked? Thanks for any answers! Really excited to see where we can go with this project. Miketout and the other devs on this team are amazing! We need more Youtube interviews than just the one with Crypto Rich. üôÇ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <VirtualSoundNW> 1. Staking benefit: you have a small chance to win 24 coins in the current epoch for each staked block if your wallet is staking. Reward declines in later epochs.
2. Take your hashes / network hashes to get a rough estimate of your chance to mine. 
3. If you're staking with a wallet, any public (non-Z address keyed) VerusCoins you've moved in will be staked.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <2Faze> @CryptoAlex thx which wallet is recommended to store verus? Any mobile available?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <CryptoAlex> @2Faze You can get the Agama GUI or CLI for desktop on the verus website. There is a mobile version for android that will be released after sapling activation (oct 28). 

miketout (lead dev) wrote about it last monday on software discussion channel:
"there is an Agama mobile wallet available for Android now, which supports Verus, and once we get past the Sapling activation, which includes pool, electrum, and lite mode updates still to happen, we will focus on completing a very nice React Native mobile wallet that is already in the works and will have a number of unique features that we believe will make a difference, can't talk about specifics quite yet or when."

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <2Faze> Thank you man i am married with iphone so have to choose desktop wallet for now and looking forward to a mobile later! What is the differenz between GUI and CLI?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrdvrsc] <CryptoAlex> GUI - Graphic User Interface
CLI - Command-LIne tool
